docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s commitment to tackling entitlement reform demonstrates his awareness of the issues that need to define the 2012 presidential election.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column praises Mitt Romney for his commitment to tackling entitlement reform; notes that Romney's proposals demonstrate his awareness of the issues that need to define the 2012 presidential election.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney’s commitment to tackling entitlement reform demonstrates his awareness of the issues that need to define the 2012 presidential election.

docs.lead_paragraph: Any person who takes risks that might lead to a government bailout — that is, any employee of a bank — should be paid no more than a civil servant.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Professor Nassim Nicholas Taleb asserts that the way to ensure that bankers and other finance industry executives stop taking outsized risks is by putting in place regulations to eliminate their bonuses.
docs.snippet: Any person who takes risks that might lead to a government bailout — that is, any employee of a bank — should be paid no more than a civil servant.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the coming months, Medicare will start taking patient satisfaction into account when reimbursing hospitals.

headline.seo: Patients’ Grades to Affect Hospitals’ Medicare Reimbursements
headline.main: Test for Hospital Budgets: Are the Patients Pleased?
headline.print_headline: Test for Hospital Budgets: Are the Patients Pleased?

docs.abstract: Winning praise from patients has become pressing issue for hospitals nationwide as Medicare prepares to start taking patient satisfaction into account when arranging reimbursement payments; shift is part of changes mandated by Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: In the coming months, Medicare will start taking patient satisfaction into account when reimbursing hospitals.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: FAULKNER--Walter T. Sound Shore Health System mourns the passing of our dear friend and colleague, Walter T. Faulkner. Together with his family, Walter was a steadfast supporter of Sound Shore Medical Center of Westchester and a devoted member of the Board of Governors, serving from 1985 to 2009. During this time he was active on the Law and Insurance Committees. His commitment to providing our community with the highest level of health care services by furthering the mission of the Medical Center will be forever remembered at Sound Shore. We will miss his guidance and support. Our deepest sympathies are extended to his to his wife Joan and their family. Mauro C. Romita, Chairman John R. Spicer, Pres. & CEO

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  FAULKNER, WALTER T
